word_mean: 改善，转佳：如患者病情之改善

sentence.Network_en: One of the most startling proposals for amelioration, in fact, came from Wall Street.
sentence.Network_cn: 实际上, 最令人注意的改良建议之一出自华尔街.

sentence.Network_en: No other question received as much attention or stimulated as many investigations and proposals for amelioration.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有其它问题受到如此之多的注意,或引起这样多的调查和改良的建议.

sentence.Network_en: I've heard that Liebig has made some wonderful discoveries in the amelioration of soils.
sentence.Network_cn: 我听人说利比黑在改善土壤这方面有过很了不得的发现.

entry.def: If someone or something ameliorates a situation, they make it better or easier in some way.

example.ex: Nothing can be done to ameliorate the situation...
example.tran: 做什么也无法使情况好转。

example.ex: He expected me to do something to ameliorate his depression.
example.tran: 他希望我做点什么好让他不那么沮丧。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of relieving ills and changing for the better

auth_sentence.content: We have got them in good locations and more in the pipeline, but that's where you will see an amelioration or a modification.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have got them in good locations and more in the pipeline, but that's where you will see an amelioration or a modification.
